title: Comparative Process of Generative vs. Completion Strategies for Enhancing Programming Learning Outcomes

context.prior_knowledge: Basic programming syntax and algorithm comprehension
context.additional_context: A customized course for in-service elementary education practitioners to improve programming skills linked to mathematics curricula, conducted in a mobile learning environment utilizing personal devices (BYOD).

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the strengths and weaknesses of generative and completion strategies in programming problem-solving processes.
Learners can select programming learning strategies suited to their cognitive style (impulsive/reflective) and achieve over 80% task accuracy.
Learners can complete one math-education programming solution through PBL assessment and suggest improvements via peer evaluation.

resources: Sample Code Library for Mathematics Education

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
